title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2020 that focus on ethics in natural language processing (NLP) and best practices
Data Statements for NLP: Toward Mitigating System Bias and Enabling Better Science
container-title: Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Discusses the use of data statements to document datasets and mitigate bias
The Social Impact of Natural Language Processing
container-title: Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 2: Short Papers

title: Explores the social implications of NLP technologies

author.literal: **Blodgett, S. L., Barocas, S., Daumé III, H., & Wallach, H.

title: Language (Technology) is Power: A Critical Survey of 'Bias' in NLP
container-title: Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: A comprehensive survey on bias in NLP systems

author.literal: **Gebru, T., Morgenstern, J., Vecchione, B., Vaughan, J. W., Wallach, H., Daumé III, H., & Crawford, K.

title: Datasheets for Datasets
Proposes the use of datasheets for datasets to improve transparency and accountability
Model Cards for Model Reporting
container-title: Proceedings of the Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency

title: Introduces model cards to document the performance and limitations of machine learning models
AI can be sexist and racist — it’s time to make it fair
Discusses the biases in AI and the need for fairness
There is a blind spot in AI research
Highlights the ethical blind spots in AI research
Predictive Biases in Natural Language Processing Models: A Conceptual Framework and Overview
container-title: Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Provides a framework for understanding predictive biases in NLP models
Mitigating Gender Bias in Natural Language Processing: Literature Review
container-title: Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: A review of methods to mitigate gender bias in NLP
Large Image Datasets: A Pyrrhic Win for Computer Vision?
container-title: Proceedings of the 2021 Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency

title: Discusses the ethical implications of large datasets in computer vision, with relevance to NLP
Actionable Auditing: Investigating the Impact of Publicly Naming Biased Performance Results of Commercial AI Products
container-title: Proceedings of the 2019 AAAI/ACM Conference on AI, Ethics, and Society

title: Examines the impact of auditing and public disclosure of AI biases
The Myth in the Methodology: Towards a Recontextualization of Fairness in Machine Learning
container-title: Proceedings of the Machine Learning: The Debates Workshop at ICML.**

title: Critiques current fairness methodologies in machine learning
Fairness in Machine Learning: Lessons from Political Philosophy
container-title: Proceedings of the 2018 Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency

title: Applies political philosophy to fairness in machine learning
Measuring and Mitigating Unintended Bias in Text Classification
container-title: Proceedings of the 2018 AAAI/ACM Conference on AI, Ethics, and Society

title: Focuses on measuring and mitigating bias in text classification
‘It's Reducing a Human Being to a Percentage’: Perceptions of Justice in Algorithmic Decisions
container-title: Proceedings of the 2018 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

title: Investigates perceptions of justice in algorithmic decision-making
Hateful Symbols or Hateful People? Predictive Features for Hate Speech Detection on Twitter
container-title: Proceedings of the NAACL Student Research Workshop

title: Examines features for detecting hate speech on Twitter
Semantics derived automatically from language corpora contain human-like biases
Demonstrates that word embeddings contain human-like biases
Designing Against Discrimination in Online Markets
Discusses design strategies to prevent discrimination in online markets
Lipstick on a Pig: Debiasing Methods Cover up Systematic Gender Biases in Word Embeddings But do not Remove Them
container-title: Proceedings of the 2019 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies

title: Critiques the effectiveness of debiasing methods for word embeddings
Understanding Undesirable Word Embedding Associations
container-title: Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Analyzes undesirable associations in word embeddings
These articles cover a range of topics related to ethics and best practices in NLP, including bias mitigation, fairness, transparency, and the social impact of NLP technologies
